annotations.text:
Burrell, Ian, 2003, Museum grants tied to rise in ethnic minority visitors, 6th December,
London: The Independent.
Camarena, C., & Morales, T., 2006, Community Museums and Global Connections: the
Union of Community Museums of Oaxaca, in I. Karp, C.A. Kratz et.al. (ed)
Museum Frictions: Public cultures/global transformations, 322–346, Durham,
N.C.: Duke University Press.
Candlin, Fiona, 2012, Independent Museums, Heritage, and the Shape of Museum
Studies, Museum & Society, March 2012 10(1) 28–41.
Carlin, John, W., 2001, Your Past is Disappearing: What Museums should know about
the 20th century Archive's crisis, (Lord & Lord 2001).
Carnegie, E., 1994, Trying to Be an Honest Woman: Making women's histories, in
G.Kavanagh (ed) Making Histories in Museums, 54–65, London: Leicester
University Press.
Cherry, D. and Cullen, F., 2008, Spectacle and Display, Maiden, Mass.; Oxford:
Blackwell Publishing.
Corsane, Gerard, 2005, Heritage, Museums and Galleries: An Introductory Reader,
New York: Routledge.
Crooke, Elizebath, 2007, Museums and Community: Ideas, issues and challenges,
London: Routledge.
Cummings, Neil, Lewandowska, Marysia, 2000, The Value of Things, Basel: Birkhauser.
Debary, O, 2004, Deindustrialisation and Museumification: From Exhibited Memory to
forgotten history.
Deuchar, Stephen, 2002, Whose Art History? Curators, academics, and the museum
visitor in Britain in the 1980s and 1990s', in C.W. Haxthausen (ed) The Two Art
Histories: The museum and the university, 3–13, Yale University Press.
Dicks, B., 2000, Heritage, Place and Community, Cardiff: University of Wales Press.
Dudley, Sandra, 2009, Museum Materialities: Objects, Engagements, Interpretations,
London: Routledge.
Duncan, Carol, 1995, Civilizing Rituals: Inside Public Art Museums, London: Routledge.
Fitzgerald, L., 1996, Hard men, hard facts and heavy metal: making histories of
technology, in G. Kavanagh (ed) Making Histories in Museums, 116–130,
London: Leicester University Press.
Giebelhausen, Michaela, 2003, The Architecture of the Museum: Symbolic structures,
urban contexts, Manchester/New York: Manchester University Press.
Haan, R.B., 2006, Re–Staging Histories and Identities in S. Macdonald (ed) A
Companion to Museum Studies, 186–197, Malden, Mass. Oxford: Blackwell
Publishing.
Lord, Barry and Lord, Gail Dexter, 2001, The Manual of Museum Exhibitions, New York
and Oxford: Alta Mira Press.
Mc Lean, Kathleen, 2001, Museum Exhibitions and the Dynamics of Dialogue, (Lord
and Lord 2001).
Moses, Richard Pearce, 2001, Janus in Cyberspace: Archives on the threshold of
Digital Era, The American Archivist Vol. 70.
Maroevic, Ivo, 1998, Introduction to Museology: The Euoropean Approach, London:
Muller–Straten.
Schlebecker, John, T., 1977, The Use of objects in Historical Research, Quarterly
journal of the Agricultural History Society Vol. 51.
Thakurta, Tapati Guha, 2002, The Endangered Yakshi: Careers of An Ancient Art
Object in Modern India, in Partha Chatterjee and Anjan Ghosh, ed., History and
the Present, New Delhi: Permanent Black.
